docs.snippet: The defeat of the New-York Health bill in the Assembly causes more sadness than indignation among the reflecting portions of our community. Its object is so purely beneficent, the necessity for some measure of the kind is so pressing and imperative,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The defeat of the New-York Health bill in the Assembly causes more sadness than indignation among the reflecting portions of our community. Its object is so purely beneficent, the necessity for some measure of the kind is so pressing and imperative, and the lives of thousands of children during the approaching Summer depend so directly upon its enactment, that no one can regard its rejection without sorrow and profound regret.

headline.main: FROM ALBANY.; THE NEW COMMISSIONERS OF POLICE.-- Passage of the Supply Bill. SENATE. ASSEMBLY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate closed the fillibustering on the Almshouse resolution this afternoon, by ordering the bill to be read a third time at 7 o'clock this evening. At that hour it was read, and the vote being taken, the resolution was lost-ayes 16, noes 13. Five Republicans voted in the negative. A motion to reconsider was made, and laid on the table. The bill will pass the Senate.

docs.snippet: Mr. SUMNER, of Massachusetts, moved in the Senate yesterday a resolution calling upon the President for information in regard to the seizure of Mexican vessels in time of peace, and their disposition agreeably to the law of prizes applicable to a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. SUMNER, of Massachusetts, moved in the Senate yesterday a resolution calling upon the President for information in regard to the seizure of Mexican vessels in time of peace, and their disposition agreeably to the law of prizes applicable to a state of war. It was adopted. Notice was given by Mr.WILSON, of Massachusetts, of a bill to suppress the Slave-trade.

docs.snippet: NEW-YORK RESCUING COMPANY PUBLIC EXHIBITION: A volunteer association with the above title, which has lately been started in this City for the purpose of saving life and property in case of fire, gave a public exhibition yesterday afternoon in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW-YORK RESCUING COMPANY PUBLIC EXHIBITION: A volunteer association with the above title, which has lately been started in this City for the purpose of saving life and property in case of fire, gave a public exhibition yesterday afternoon in the rear of No. 171 Christie-street.
